intro: Raoulia youngii, commonly known as the young's raoulia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a yellow center. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branching. Raoulia youngii is typically found in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of New Caledonia.
